thread.title: Indian teenager wakes up on the way to his own funeral
thread.title_full: Indian teenager wakes up on the way to his own funeral

title: Indian teenager wakes up on the way to his own funeral
text:
Indian teenager wakes up on the way to his own funeral   
A teenager from India woke up to find he was en route to his own funeral, after his family believed a dog bite had killed him. 
Kumar Marewad, 17, was bitten by a stray dog a month ago, which left him hospitalised and in a critical condition, with suspected meningoencephalitis. 
After the infection spread throughout his body, doctors told his parents last week he would not survive, the Times of India reported. 123RF 
After the teen's family turned off his life support, he appeared not to be breathing so they decided he was dead. 
Marewad's parents made the decision to turn off life support and allow their son to die at home. 
READ MORE: * Girl who woke up at her funeral 'has died' 
"We had decided to take Kumar home after doctors told us his chances of survival were bleak once taken off the ventilator," said Sharanappa Naikar, Marewad's brother-in-law. 
The family said after the life support system was turned off, Marewad appeared not to be breathing or moving, so they decided he was dead. 
But just over two kilometres from where the funeral was planned, Marewad opened his eyes and started hyperventilating, the Times of India reported . 
He was brought back to hospital, where he is in a critical condition, and given a ventilator. Ad Feedback 
Kumar's parents, who are both labourers, told the Times of India their son dropped out of school to support the family. 
"He used to work as a construction labourer. His elder brother is physically challenged. We need support for his treatment." - Stuff
